title: Webcam Feeds of New York City Draw Viewers Trapped in Lockdown
sub_head: Folks around the world who can’t board a plane use cams to ‘travel’ to the city
body:
When streaming video service VUit launched in September, the coronavirus upended its plans to broadcast live shows from its Manhattan studio. On a whim, employees turned the studio’s camera out the window to face the nondescript corner of Sixth Avenue and 39th Street. The 24-hour street-scene feed quickly became the service’s most popular channel, beating out dozens of live news and sports broadcasts.
Last week, I watched the online feed with Jack Perry, the CEO and founder of VUit’s parent company, Syncbak, and asked him to narrate the action.
“There goes three shoppers,” he said, as several pedestrians traversed the crosswalk.
A few moments passed.
“Look, someone’s carrying their Starbucks . And there’s a FedEx truck,” he said. “That’s the second time it’s come around.”
